canvas_sdk.client.request_context module¶

class canvas_sdk.client.request_context.RequestContext(auth_token, base_api_url, max_retries=0, per_page=None, headers=None, cookies=None, timeout=None, proxies=None, verify=True, cert=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class that holds the default configuration values used to make Canvas API requests. The requests library is heavily leveraged in terms of the attributes that may be passed in. Most of the attributes are used to construct a requests.Session instance that by default will be reused across requests made with a given RequestContext. See below for a full list of parameters:

Parameters:
  • auth_token (str) – OAuth2 token retrieved from a Canvas site
  • base_api_url (str) – The api endpoint of the Canvas site in the form “http(s)://[canvas.site.com]/api”
  • per_page (int) – (optional) For get requests that return a list of data, this will be used as the default per_page value
  • max_retries (int) – (optional) Number of times a request that generates a certain class of HTTP exception will be retried before being raised back to the caller. See client.base for a list of those error types.
  • headers (dictionary) – (optional) dictionary of headers to send for each request. Will be merged with a default set of headers.
  • cookies (dictionary or CookieJar) – (optional) Cookies to attach to each requests.
  • timeout (float) – (optional) The timeout of the request in seconds.
  • proxies (dictionary) – (optional) Mapping protocol to the URL of the proxy.
  • verify (boolean or str) – (optional) if True, the SSL cert will be verified. A CA_BUNDLE path can also be provided.
  • cert (str or Tuple) – (optional) if String, path to ssl client cert file (.pem). If Tuple, (‘cert’, ‘key’) pair.
auth[source]¶

A custom OAuth2 authentication handler for the instance’s auth_token

expire_session()[source]¶

To expire a session, it just needs to be set to None according to requests doc.

classmethod get_default_headers()[source]¶

These are headers that are sent with every API request. Be careful of overriding these headers since the API calls may not work if these are modified.

session[source]¶

Get or set a requests.Session instance based on the session related values passed into the class. The setter should only be used if you need fine-grained control over your session. You can refer to the requests library documentation for information on available options for the session object: http://docs.python-requests.org/ NOTE: Refer to the setup.py file to match up the version of the Requests library the SDK uses with the right doc version.
